text: That would be great. I'm still not having any luck
Anyone know if you can build multilevel dynamic pages with custom CRM objects?
We do not natively support multi level pages with CRM
<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6> Have you seen anybody achieving this in some other custom ways?

<@UATE4ATHP> are you referring to doing this but with COâ€™s?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/content/data-driven-content/dynamic-pages/multilevel>
Ah ok, <@UG52C29EE> I havent personally seen anyone do this. This is an interesting use case though! Are you ok with me passing this feedback internally to others?

Yeah for sure.

Here is my use case, I'm creating a page grader and the URL will be ... <http://example.com/grader/USERS_URL|example.com/grader/USERS_URL>

I'm storing the grades as a custom object. But there's also sub grades/reports, which would be their own custom objects.

And I want to do this

<http://example.com/grader/USERS_URL/report1|example.com/grader/USERS_URL/report1>
<http://example.com/grader/USERS_URL/report2|example.com/grader/USERS_URL/report2>

I think for now I can just do a separate dynamic page, based off of the second custom object

So like this

<http://example.com/grader/report1/USERS_URL|example.com/grader/report1/USERS_URL>

I've heard of someone using query params for the sub pages. Using graphql or hubl functions to get the data for the second level pages. So it isnt really a second level dynamic page but you get a similar experience the key difference is just the URL requiring a query param rather than a path.

I may have evn built something like this myself but its been a long time, can't think of where.
Yeah Ive considered that, may go that route
